title: Why Verizon Decided to Still Buy Yahoo After Big Data Breaches - Wall Street Journal
text:
Why Verizon Decided to Still Buy Yahoo After Big Data Breaches Companies announce revised agreement Google+ Updated Feb. 21, 2017 8:18 a.m. ET 
Verizon Communications Inc. outbid several suitors to buy Yahoo Inc.â€™s struggling internet business last year. But the phone giant had to scramble to keep the deal from unraveling after Yahoo disclosed two massive data breaches. 
The companies have agreed to revise the $4.83 billion deal, cutting $350 million off the price and evenly splitting costs from the breaches.
